TITLE: Elon Musk delays $8 'blue check' Twitter verification plan until after the midterms
SUMMARY: Twitter is delaying the rollout of account verifications for its paid Twitter Blue subscription plan until after the midterm elections, a source with knowledge of the decision confirmed to CNN.

TITLE: Twitter could be a new wild card for the midterms
SUMMARY: For years, Twitter has been a leader in countering misinformation and protecting elections. It was often ahead of its peers in creating and enforcing new policies, and it was the first major platform to ban former President Donald Trump after the Capitol insurrection, pushing others to follow suit.

TITLE: Kathy Griffin suspended from Twitter for impersonating Elon Musk
SUMMARY: Twitter has suspended comedian Kathy Griffin for impersonating the company's new owner, Elon Musk.

TITLE: Airbnb to make prices clearer after user complaints of hidden fees
SUMMARY: Airbnb on Monday said it plans to make the total cost of rental properties, including all fees, clearer to customers as they search for places to stay, addressing what is arguably one of the biggest pet peeves about the platform.

TITLE: Meta said to be planning significant layoffs
SUMMARY: Facebook-parent Meta is said to be planning the first significant layoffs in its history as the company grapples with a shrinking business and fears of a looming recession.

TITLE: Why Apple may be working on a 'hey Siri' change
SUMMARY: Apple reportedly wants to put an end to "Hey."

TITLE: Wall Street Journal: Meta said to be planning significant layoffs
SUMMARY: Facebook-parent Meta is said to be planning the first significant layoffs in its history as the company grapples with a shrinking business and fears of a looming recession, according to the Wall Street Journal.

TITLE: Wall Street Journal: Meta is planning significant layoffs
SUMMARY: Facebook-parent Meta is planning the first significant layoffs in its history as the company grapples with a shrinking business and fears of a looming recession, according to the Wall Street Journal.

TITLE: iPhone factory workers in China offered bonuses to return to work
SUMMARY: One of Apple's largest suppliers is trying to strike a delicate balance in China.

TITLE: A beginner's guide to Mastodon, the Twitter alternative that's on ðŸ”¥
SUMMARY: If you've heard the word "mastodon" a lot since Elon Musk took over Twitter in late October, here's why: The extinct mammal is also the name of a relatively small, formerly little-known social network that has skyrocketed in popularity, as many Twitter users try it out as an alternative for connecting with others online.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes' request for a new trial is denied
SUMMARY: A federal judge has denied Elizabeth Holmes' request for a new trial, according to court filings on Monday, paving the way for the founder of failed blood testing startup Theranos to be sentenced later this month.

TITLE: EU opens deeper probe of Microsoft's Activision deal
SUMMARY: The European Union is taking a closer look at Microsoft's proposed $68.7 billion purchase of video game giant Activision Blizzard, citing concerns the deal could hurt competition in the video game industry.

TITLE: Wall Street Journal: Mark Zuckerberg tells employees layoffs coming Wednesday
SUMMARY: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg told company executives that major layoffs at the tech giant will begin on Wednesday morning, the Wall Street Journal reported Tuesday afternoon.

TITLE: Twitter to debut gray 'official' check mark to verify government accounts, media and major brands
SUMMARY: Twitter said Tuesday evening that to resolve ambiguity about which accounts on its platform have been identity-verified â€” as opposed to those simply paying $8 a month for a blue check mark on their profiles â€” the company will introduce a new, gray check mark as part of an "official" label.

TITLE: Meta to lay off 11,000 employees, 13% of workforce
SUMMARY: Facebook-parent Meta on Wednesday said it is laying off 11,000 employees, marking the most significant job cuts in the tech giant's history.

TITLE: Layoffs could weaken Twitter in its biggest global growth markets
SUMMARY: It's less than two weeks since Elon Musk completed his acquisition of Twitter and already there are concerns that the company is choosing to ignore key risks in its biggest international growth markets.

TITLE: Why Twitter is rolling out gray 'official' check marks
SUMMARY: Days after Elon Musk promised to blow up Twitter's account verification process by giving anyone the option to pay for a blue check mark, he appears to have accepted that some prominent users do need to actually be verified after all.

TITLE: Germany blocks sale of chip factory to China over security fears
SUMMARY: The German government has blocked the sale of one of its semiconductor factories to a Chinese-owned tech company because of security concerns.

TITLE: Tesla drivers will be able to make Zoom calls from their car
SUMMARY: Tesla drivers will soon be able to take a video call directly from their vehicle's touchscreen dashboard, Zoom announced Tuesday.

TITLE: Twitter briefly rolled out gray 'official' check marks. Then Elon Musk changed his mind
SUMMARY: A new verification mark intended to better identify prominent Twitter accounts has instead become the latest source of chaos at the company under new owner Elon Musk.

TITLE: Elon Musk pleads with advertisers to stay on Twitter
SUMMARY: Twitter owner Elon Musk pleaded with advertisers to keep using his platform on Wednesday as he sketched out his plans for user verification, content moderation and even his intention to add banking features to Twitter in front of a live audience of over 100,000 users.

TITLE: Biden says Elon Musk's relationship with other countries 'worthy of being looked at'
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden said Twitter owner and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's relationship with other countries was "worthy of being looked at," but declined to say how that could be done.

TITLE: Twitter battles wave of impersonators after launching new paid verification system
SUMMARY: Twitter appears to be battling a wave of celebrity and corporate impersonators on its platform who have quickly gamed the company's new paid verification system, hours after its launch

TITLE: The sudden decline of one of the largest crypto exchanges could rattle the sports industry
SUMMARY: The near collapse this week of FTX, one of the largest cryptocurrency exchanges, has sent shockwaves throughout the crypto startup and investment community. But the fallout could also spread to the sports industry.

TITLE: This company wants to make air travel sustainable
SUMMARY: In 2019, Air Company made a splash when it launched vodka derived from recaptured carbon, in an effort to reduce the amount of the harmful greenhouse gas in the atmosphere.

TITLE: Twitter's cybersecurity chief quits amid company turmoil
SUMMARY: Twitter's chief information security officer announced their resignation on Thursday, vacating one of the company's most critical roles just as scrutiny is mounting over Twitter's future and the erratic decisions of its new owner, Elon Musk.

TITLE: Silicon Valley's greatest minds misread pandemic demand. Now their employees are paying for it.
SUMMARY: In the early months of the pandemic, Facebook only grew bigger and more central to our lives. With lockdowns spreading, countless people began shopping, socializing and working on Facebook and other online platforms. As CEO Mark Zuckerberg said in March 2020, usage was so high that the company was "just trying to keep the lights on."

TITLE: Twitter executives quit amid company turmoil
SUMMARY: Twitter's chief information security officer announced their resignation on Thursday, vacating one of the company's most critical roles just as scrutiny is mounting over Twitter's future and the erratic decisions of its new owner, Elon Musk.

TITLE: Australia blames Russian-linked ransomware gang for Medibank data breach
SUMMARY: Cyber criminals with links to Russia are behind the attack on one of Australia's largest private health insurers, the Australian Federal Police (AFP) said Friday.

TITLE: Australia blames Russian-linked cyber criminals for Medibank data breach
SUMMARY: Cyber criminals with links to Russia are behind a ransomware attack on one of Australia's largest private health insurers that's seen sensitive personal data published to the dark web, the Australian Federal Police (AFP) said Friday.

TITLE: Australia blames cyber criminals in Russia for Medibank data breach
SUMMARY: Cyber criminals in Russia are behind a ransomware attack on one of Australia's largest private health insurers that's seen sensitive personal data published to the dark web, the Australian Federal Police (AFP) said Friday.

TITLE: Apple curbs AirDrop file sharing on devices in China
SUMMARY: Apple has limited the use of the AirDrop wireless file sharing function on devices in China, just weeks after reports that some protesters had used the popular feature to spread messages critical of the Chinese government.

TITLE: A day of chaos brings Twitter closer to the brink
SUMMARY: Two weeks after Elon Musk completed his acquisition of Twitter, the future of the company has never looked less certain.

TITLE: Musk's Twitter may have already violated its latest FTC consent order, legal experts say
SUMMARY: Just two weeks into Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter, the company may have already violated its consent agreement with the Federal Trade Commission, legal experts said.

TITLE: A guide to parental controls on social media
SUMMARY: A little over a year ago, social media companies were put on notice for how they protect, or fail to protect, their youngest users.

TITLE: Elon Musk says 'I have too much work on my plate'
SUMMARY: Billionaire Elon Musk said on Monday he was working "at the absolute most amount ... from morning til night, seven days a week" when asked about his recent acquisition of Twitter and his leadership of automaker Tesla.

TITLE: How an 'electronic nose' could help fight wildfires
SUMMARY: German startup Dryad has designed a cheap sensor that it says could drastically speed up the detection of wildfires, reducing damage and cutting carbon emissions.

TITLE: Elon Musk's SpaceX is buying an ad package on Elon Musk's Twitter
SUMMARY: While a number of major brands have announced advertising pauses on Twitter in the wake of Elon Musk's acquisition, the platform has scored a new ad buy from one notable billion-dollar business: Musk's SpaceX.

TITLE: Google agrees to $392 million settlement with 40 states over location tracking practices
SUMMARY: Google has agreed to a record $391.5 million settlement with 40 states for allegedly misleading consumers over its location tracking practices, a coalition of attorneys general announced Monday.

TITLE: New York Times: Amazon plans to lay off thousands of employees
SUMMARY: Amazon is planning to lay off some 10,000 employees in corporate and technology jobs, the New York Times reported on Monday, citing anonymous sources with knowledge of the matter.

TITLE: Apple invested $450 million in a satellite-powered SOS system. We tested it out
SUMMARY: When Apple announced at its closely-watched September product launch event that it would soon introduce an Emergency SOS feature powered by a network of satellites orbiting above Earth, Brooklyn probably wasn't the secluded location most had in mind for using it.

TITLE: We tried Apple's new SOS tool for when you don't have cell service
SUMMARY: When Apple announced at its closely-watched September product launch event that it would soon introduce an Emergency SOS feature powered by a network of satellites orbiting above Earth, Brooklyn probably wasn't the secluded location most had in mind for using it.

TITLE: Amazon launches message-based virtual clinic for allergies, acne and hair loss
SUMMARY: Amazon on Tuesday launched a virtual clinic to treat common health conditions, including allergies, acne and hair loss, in the latest move by the e-commerce giant to expand its reach into the health care industry.

TITLE: Twitter chaos spills into public view as Musk clashes with and fires employees on the platform
SUMMARY: Elon Musk has publicly clashed with a growing number of Twitter employees about the state of the platform, and fired at least one of them in a tweet, in an unusually visible sign of corporate chaos after his $44 billion takeover of the influential company.

TITLE: Elon Musk gives ultimatum to Twitter employees: Do 'extremely hardcore' work or get out
SUMMARY: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk has given employees until Thursday evening to commit to "extremely hardcore" work or else leave the company, according to a copy of a late-night internal email sent by the billionaire and obtained by CNN.

TITLE: Amazon confirms it has begun laying off employees
SUMMARY: Amazon confirmed on Wednesday that layoffs had begun at the company, two days after multiple outlets reported the e-commerce giant planned to cut around 10,000 employees this week.

TITLE: UK orders Chinese-owned company to sell Britain's biggest chipmaker
SUMMARY: The UK government has ordered a Chinese-owned company to unwind its takeover of Britain's biggest chipmaker, citing national security concerns.

TITLE: Elon Musk is planning a subtle change to Twitter that could make it harder to stop the bots
SUMMARY: Elon Musk has been saying for months that he wants to stamp out spam and fake accounts on Twitter, but a subtle change he's planning to make to the platform could complicate that goal.

TITLE: These fireball-dropping drones are on the frontlines of wildfire prevention
SUMMARY: As US wildfires have grown larger and deadlier in recent years, one company is using drones and fire-starting "dragon eggs" to help prevent extreme blazes and save firefighters' lives.

TITLE: What a Republican-controlled House could mean for Silicon Valley
SUMMARY: With Republicans projected to take control of the House as a result of the midterm elections, tech giants such as Amazon, Google and Meta, who've been in the crosshairs of Democrats in recent years, are soon set to face a very different â€” but no less hostile â€” political climate in Washington.

TITLE: Good luck finding an iPhone 14 Pro before Christmas
SUMMARY: If you haven't ordered one of the higher-end iPhone 14 models by now, it may be harder than usual to get one before the holidays.

TITLE: Airbnb CEO on the tech downturn: 'It's like we're all in a nightclub and the lights just came on'
SUMMARY: After years of seemingly unstoppable growth, the tech industry is now facing the "ultimate reality check" as it confronts broader economic uncertainty and waves of layoffs, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky told CNN on Thursday.

TITLE: It's decision day for Twitter employees on whether to work under Musk
SUMMARY: One day after Elon Musk gave Twitter employees an ultimatum to commit to working in an "extremely hardcore" fashion at the company or leave, some staffers are preparing to exit the company while others are wrestling with the decision.

TITLE: The rise and fall of Elizabeth Holmes: A timeline
SUMMARY: More than three years after Elizabeth Holmes was first indicted and nearly four months after her trial kicked off, the founder and former CEO of failed blood testing startup Theranos was found guilty on four out of 11 federal fraud and conspiracy charges.

TITLE: Twitter employees head for the exits after Elon Musk' 'extremely hardcore' work ultimatum
SUMMARY: Another employee exodus appears to be underway at Twitter as many workers rejected Elon Musk's ultimatum to work "extremely hardcore," choosing instead to depart the company, according to multiple current and former employees.

TITLE: Amazon CEO says job cuts will continue into next year
SUMMARY: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said job cuts at the e-commerce giant would continue into early next year, in his first public remarks since the company began widespread layoffs earlier this week.

TITLE: Twitter employees head for the exits after Elon Musk's 'extremely hardcore' work ultimatum
SUMMARY: Another employee exodus appears to be underway at Twitter as many workers rejected Elon Musk's terms for staying with the company, choosing instead to depart, according to multiple current and former employees.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes scheduled to be sentenced on Friday
SUMMARY: Elizabeth Holmes, the founder of failed blood testing startup Theranos who was convicted of fraud earlier this year, is scheduled to be sentenced on Friday morning by a judge in court in San Jose, California.

TITLE: As Twitter staff empties out, users fear the worst for platform
SUMMARY: On Thursday night, following another exodus of Twitter employees, the outage detection site Down Detector showed a spike in users reporting issues accessing the social media platform. A chart of the sharp increase in outage reports was shared by some users on Twitter, appearing to validate a growing fear that the site would struggle to stay online with fewer staff. But that wasn't exactly the case just yet.

TITLE: Twitter is the world's digital public square. What if it dies?
SUMMARY: If Twitter were to suddenly cease to exist, the consequences would be enormous, given how integral the platform is to global communications.

TITLE: What to do if you're worried about your Twitter account going away
SUMMARY: As #RIPTwitter continues to trend on Twitter itself and a legion of engineers and other staffers exit the company, some users are preparing for a world without their accounts.

TITLE: Elon Musk unbans several controversial Twitter accounts, but says not yet on Trump
SUMMARY: Elon Musk on Friday said Twitter plans to restore several controversial accounts that had previously been banned or suspended, but added that the company has not yet made a decision about the account of former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes sentenced to more than 11 years in prison for fraud
SUMMARY: Elizabeth Holmes was sentenced to more than 11 years in prison on Friday following her conviction in January for defrauding investors while running the failed blood testing startup Theranos.

TITLE: Twitter was already in disarray. Trump's return will only make it more chaotic
SUMMARY: With his decision on Saturday to restore the personal Twitter account of former President Donald Trump nearly two years after it was permanently banned, Elon Musk could plunge Twitter deeper into chaos â€” and that may be the point.

TITLE: Kindle's 15-year anniversary is a reminder simplicity is king
SUMMARY: Len Edgerly, a 72-year-old podcaster from Cambridge, Massachusetts, has spent the last 14 and a half years talking about his favorite tech product of all time: the Kindle.

TITLE: Is AI art really art? This California gallery says yes
SUMMARY: As artificial intelligence becomes increasingly popular for generating images, a question has roiled the art world: Can AI create art?

TITLE: Collapsed FTX owes nearly $3.1 billion to top 50 creditors
SUMMARY: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX, which has filed for US bankruptcy court protection, said it owes its 50 biggest creditors nearly $3.1 billion.

TITLE: Twitter Africa employees accuse Elon Musk of discrimination over severance terms
SUMMARY: Laid-off employees at Twitter's Africa headquarters are accusing Twitter of "deliberately and recklessly flouting the laws of Ghana" and trying to "silence and intimidate" them after they were fired.

TITLE: Twitter won't restore Alex Jones' account, Elon Musk says
SUMMARY: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones won't be returning to Twitter and will remain banned from the platform, according to its new owner, Elon Musk.

TITLE: As Meta and Twitter slash staff, TikTok plans to keep hiring
SUMMARY: While much of Silicon Valley is grappling with hiring freezes and job cuts, at least one social media company is still planning to keep hiring: TikTok.
Five days after its successful launch, NASA's Artemis I reached just 80 miles above the moon's surface. Previously the spacecraft also shared impressive views of the Earth.

TITLE: Elon Musk says Twitter is 'holding off' restarting paid verification over impersonation concerns
SUMMARY: Elon Musk said Monday evening that Twitter is "holding off" the restart of his paid account verification plan over continued concerns of impersonation on the social media platform.

TITLE: The federal government just took another big swipe at illegal robocalls
SUMMARY: The federal government took another big swipe at illegal robocalls on Tuesday, as it moved to block a voice provider from the entire US phone network for the very first time.

TITLE: Elon Musk has upended Twitter's business. Here's how he could fix it
SUMMARY: Much of Twitter's ad sales team has been fired or pushed out. Large companies from General Mills to Macy's have paused advertising on the platform, with more potentially following suit after new owner Elon Musk's decision to restore the account of former President Donald Trump and other controversial figures. And any cursory scroll of the platform will likely show you fewer big brand ads.

TITLE: HP says it will lay off up to 6,000 workers over the next couple years
SUMMARY: HP Inc. announced on Tuesday that it will lay off thousands of workers over the next three years, becoming the latest tech company to significantly downsize staffing amid a souring economic climate.

TITLE: Workers at the world's largest iPhone factory in China clash with police, videos show
SUMMARY: Workers at China's largest iPhone assembly factory were seen confronting police, some in riot gear, on Wednesday, according to videos shared over social media.

TITLE: House Republicans say TikTok made misleading claims in briefings on data handling
SUMMARY: House Republicans say TikTok may have misled congressional staff in private briefings about the company's handling of US user data, in a new letter to the short-form video app this week.

TITLE: Hive is the latest Twitter alternative to gain steam â€” and to show how hard it would be to replace Twitter
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's rocky takeover of Twitter has already been marked by mass layoffs, resignations and the reinstatement of former president Donald Trump's account, as well as other controversial figures, leaving many users uncertain about the direction of the platform's future.

TITLE: Elon Musk says he will begin restoring previously banned Twitter accounts next week
SUMMARY: Elon Musk said Thursday that he will begin restoring most previously banned accounts on Twitter starting next week, in his most wide-reaching move yet to undo the social media platform's policy of permanently suspending users who repeatedly violated its rules.

TITLE: The US-China chip war is spilling over to Europe
SUMMARY: Two European chip deals have run into trouble over their links with China, a sign of concern spreading in the West over potential Chinese control of critical infrastructure.

TITLE: UK bans Chinese surveillance cameras from 'sensitive' sites
SUMMARY: Hikvision, a leading Chinese surveillance company, has denied suggestions that it poses a threat to Britain's national security after the UK government banned the use of its camera systems at "sensitive" sites.

TITLE: Musk says new color-coded verification system at Twitter will roll out in a week
SUMMARY: Elon Musk is ready to try his troubled new verification system for Twitter once again. This time, in color.

TITLE: Apple has a huge problem with its supplier's iPhone factory in China
SUMMARY: A violent workers' revolt at the world's largest iPhone factory this week in central China is further scrambling Apple's strained supply and highlighting how the country's stringent zero-Covid policy is hurting global technology firms.

TITLE: Apple has a huge problem with an iPhone factory in China
SUMMARY: A violent workers' revolt at the world's largest iPhone factory this week in central China is further scrambling Apple's strained supply and highlighting how the country's stringent zero-Covid policy is hurting global technology firms.

TITLE: A look back at Elon Musk's chaotic first month at Twitter
SUMMARY: Sunday officially marks one month since the world's richest man took the helm at Twitter.

TITLE: Irish regulator fines Meta $275 million for violations of Europe's data privacy law
SUMMARY: Meta has been fined roughly $275 million by Ireland's data privacy regulator for failing to prevent hackers from siphoning off personal information from more than 500 million Facebook users in a 2019 data leak.

TITLE: Twitter searches for China protests bombarded by spam and porn, raising alarms among researchers
SUMMARY: Twitter searches for the widespread Covid-19-related protests in China are returning a flood of spam, pornography and gibberish that some disinformation researchers say at first glance appear to be a deliberate attempt by the Chinese government or its allies to drown out images of the demonstrations.

TITLE: Elon Musk claims Apple has 'threatened to withhold' Twitter from its app store
SUMMARY: Elon Musk on Monday claimed that Apple has "threatened" to pull Twitter from its iOS app store, a move that could be devastating to the company Musk just acquired for $44 billion.

TITLE: Twitter is no longer enforcing its Covid misinformation policy
SUMMARY: Twitter said it will no longer enforce its longstanding Covid misinformation policy, yet another sign of Elon Musk's transformation of the social media company he bought a month ago.

TITLE: Snap demands employees work in office 80% of the time starting early next year
SUMMARY: Snapchat's parent company is asking workers to return to the office 80% of the time, or the equivalent of four days a week, beginning early next year, in the latest sign of tech employees receiving less flexibility nearly three years after the pandemic took hold and amid a wave of industry cost cutting.

TITLE: South Dakota governor bans state employees from using TikTok on government devices
SUMMARY: South Dakota's governor signed an executive order on Tuesday banning state agencies, employees and contractors from accessing TikTok on government devices, citing "the growing national security threat" posed by the Chinese-owned social media platform.

TITLE: Two victims of Apple store crash file lawsuits claiming negligence
SUMMARY: Two victims injured when a car drove into an Apple store filed lawsuits Tuesday morning claiming various development companies failed to protect people by not installing barriers near the store.

TITLE: Twitter is less safe due to Elon Musk's management style, says former top official
SUMMARY: Twitter owner Elon Musk's dictatorial management style risks driving the company headlong into unforced business blunders, content moderation disasters and the degradation of core platform features that help keep vulnerable users safe, according to a former top Twitter official who led the company's content moderation before abruptly resigning this month.

TITLE: China's Zhengzhou, home to world's largest iPhone factory, ends Covid lockdown
SUMMARY: The central Chinese city of Zhengzhou, home to the world's largest iPhone factory, has lifted a five-day Covid lockdown, in a move that analysts have called a much-needed relief for Apple and its main supplier Foxconn.

Twitter's former Head of Trust and Safety, Yoel Roth, joined Kara Swisher in his first public appearance since quitting Twitter where he said Twitter is less safe due to Elon Musk's management style. Kara Swisher joins "CNN This Morning" to discuss the interview.

TITLE: DoorDash to lay off 1,250 corporate employees
SUMMARY: DoorDash on Wednesday said it will lay off about 1,250 corporate employees after growing its team too quickly during the pandemic, making it the latest tech company to cut staff in recent weeks.

TITLE: Twitter must comply with Europe's platform rules, EU digital chief warns Musk in virtual meeting
SUMMARY: A top European Union official warned Twitter owner Elon Musk on Wednesday that the social media platform must take significant steps to comply with EU content moderation laws, and that European officials will be monitoring closely for compliance.

TITLE: Amazon CEO explains thinking behind layoffs as unionized warehouse workers protest outside
SUMMARY: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy on Wednesday said an "uncertain" economy pushed the e-commerce giant to move forward with rare and wide-ranging layoffs after having gone on a significant hiring spree for much of the pandemic.

TITLE: Salesforce Co-CEO Bret Taylor steps down, leaving Marc Benioff alone at the top
SUMMARY: Enterprise tech giant Salesforce said Wednesday that its co-CEO and Vice Chair Bret Taylor will step down from his roles. Salesforce co-founder Marc Benioff, who had been co-CEO alongside Taylor, will continue running the company and serving as board chair, the company said in a news release.

TITLE: Elon Musk's Neuralink shows brain implant prototype and robotic surgeon during recruiting event
SUMMARY: Elon Musk â€” the SpaceX founder, Tesla CEO, and, most recently, Twitter owner â€” hosted a flashy event on Wednesday night for yet another one of his companies: Neuralink, the startup proposing implants that connect your brain to a computer.

TITLE: Kanye West is no longer acquiring Parler, company says
SUMMARY: The rapper formerly known as Kanye West will no longer be acquiring Parler, the alternative social media platform favored by conservatives including some far-right extremists, the company announced on Thursday. West has legally changed his name to Ye.

TITLE: Kanye West's Twitter account has been suspended after Elon Musk says it violated rule against incitement to violence
SUMMARY: Kanye West's Twitter account was suspended early Friday morning after Elon Musk said it violated the platform's rules on inciting violence.

TITLE: Hate speech dramatically surges on Twitter following Elon Musk takeover, new research shows
SUMMARY: New Twitter owner Elon Musk declared last month that "hate speech impressions" had dramatically fallen on the platform since he took over.

TITLE: Released Twitter emails show how employees debated how to handle 2020 New York Post Hunter Biden story
SUMMARY: For days, Twitter owner Elon Musk had teased a massive bombshell disclosure based on internal company documents that he claimed would reveal "what really happened" inside Twitter when it decided to temporarily suppress a 2020 New York Post story about Hunter Biden and his laptop.

TITLE: Forget smartwatches, consumers are snapping up these quirky alternatives
SUMMARY: In 2015, the same year Apple introduced its smartwatch, a Kickstarter campaign launched for a very different kind of wearable device: a wellness-tracking ring called the Oura.

TITLE: Foxconn says it's restoring production at the world's largest iPhone factory
SUMMARY: Apple supplier Foxconn says it is "gradually" restoring production capacity at its sprawling campus in central China, which has been hit by Covid-19 restrictions and worker protests since October.

TITLE: The clean energy company turning city blocks greener
SUMMARY: BlocPower, a Brooklyn-based clean energy company, is bringing eco-friendly, all-electric heating and cooling systems to older buildings in lower income communities, with the goal of reducing carbon footprints and energy bills.

TITLE: DOJ antitrust regulators should look at Apple, Google's handling of TikTok, says FCC commissioner
SUMMARY: Apple and Google's continued hosting of TikTok on their app stores, despite US national security concerns about the short-form video app, reflects the tech giants' "gatekeeper" power and should be made part of any antitrust reviews the app stores may face, a member of the Federal Communications Commission wrote to the Justice Department last week.

TITLE: This AI chatbot is dominating social media with its frighteningly good essays
SUMMARY: Imagine if Siri could write you a college essay, or Alexa could spit out a movie review in the style of Shakespeare.

TITLE: Meta threatens to remove news content over US journalism bargaining bill
SUMMARY: Facebook owner Meta threatened to remove news content from its platforms on Monday following reports that US lawmakers have added controversial legislation favoring news media to the annual defense authorization bill.

TITLE: Facebook Oversight Board recommends overhaul of controversial content moderation process for VIPs
SUMMARY: After a yearlong review, Meta's Oversight Board on Tuesday said the company's controversial system that applies a different content moderation process for posts from VIPs is set up to "satisfy business concerns" and risks doing harm to everyday users.

TITLE: Microsoft could soon have its first union
SUMMARY: Some 300 quality assurance workers at Microsoft-owned gaming studio ZeniMax are in the process of voting to form what would be the first union at the tech giant, organizers confirmed to CNN Business.

TITLE: Apple sued by two women alleging their exes used AirTags to stalk them
SUMMARY: Apple has been sued by two women who allege their previous romantic partners used the company's AirTag devices to track their whereabouts, potentially putting their safety at risk.

TITLE: Apple now lets developers charge as much as $10,000 for an app
SUMMARY: If you were worried about how much money you could blow on apps before, buckle up.

TITLE: Former Theranos COO set to be sentenced
SUMMARY: Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani, the former chief operating officer of failed blood testing startup Theranos, is set to be sentenced on Wednesday for fraud, marking an end to the stunning downfall of a high-flying Silicon Valley company that resulted in the rare convictions of two tech executives.

TITLE: Meta avoids showdown over news content in US after journalism bargaining bill shelved
SUMMARY: A threat by Facebook owner Meta to remove news content from its platforms appears to have been averted â€” for now â€” after US lawmakers omitted an antitrust bill it opposed from the text of an annual defense spending bill released late Tuesday evening.

TITLE: Amazon's checkout page stops working for some users
SUMMARY: Thousands of customers looking to purchase an item on Amazon early Wednesday encountered an error message on the e-commerce site's checkout page, a rare issue for a platform that has become even more of a central shopping hub for countless households during the pandemic.

TITLE: Wordle is the most-searched term on Google in 2022
SUMMARY: Admit it: You've probably either Googled the answer for Wordle, or at the very least searched to play it. Turns out, you're not alone.

TITLE: Amazon's checkout page stopped working for some users
SUMMARY: Thousands of customers looking to purchase an item on Amazon early Wednesday encountered an error message on the e-commerce site's checkout page, a rare issue for a platform that has become even more of a central shopping hub for countless households during the pandemic.

TITLE: Uber launching self-driving cars in Las Vegas
SUMMARY: Ridehailing giant Uber is now offering Las Vegas riders the option on its app to hail a self-driving taxis developed by another company, according to a press release Wednesday. While the autonomous vehicles are currently only available for ride hailing in Las Vegas, there are plans to expand to Los Angeles "at a later date," according to the release.

TITLE: DC attorney general sues Amazon for allegedly misusing driver tips
SUMMARY: Amazon faces a new lawsuit from the attorney general of Washington, D.C. that alleges the e-commerce giant used customer tips meant for delivery drivers to reduce what it owed in driver wages.

TITLE: Microsoft says it has reached a 10-year deal to bring 'Call of Duty' to Nintendo
SUMMARY: Fans of the popular first-person shooter game "Call of Duty" may soon have more options for where they can play it.

TITLE: Former Theranos COO sentenced to nearly 13 years
SUMMARY: Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani, the former chief operating officer of failed blood testing startup Theranos,â€¯was sentenced Wednesdayâ€¯to nearly 13 years in prisonâ€¯for fraud. It marksâ€¯an end to the stunning downfall of a high-flying Silicon Valley company that resulted in the rare convictions of two tech executives.

TITLE: Indiana Attorney General files lawsuits against TikTok
SUMMARY: Indiana Attorney General Todd Rokita on Wednesday announced he has filed two separate lawsuits against TikTok, which accuse the company of making false claims about the safety of user data, and age-appropriate content.

TITLE: Apple plans to expand encryption of iCloud data
SUMMARY: Apple on Wednesday said it plans to expand end-to-end encryption of iCloud data to include backups, photos, notes, chat histories and other services, in a move that could further protect user data but also add to tensions with law enforcement around the world.

TITLE: Google to merge mapping service Waze with maps products teams
SUMMARY: Google said on Thursday it will merge teams working on mapping service Waze and products like Google Maps, effective Dec. 9, in a bid to consolidate processes.

TITLE: Biden administration urges Supreme Court to narrow Big Tech's liability shield in pivotal Google case
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has told the US Supreme Court that social media platforms ought to be potentially liable for recommendations made by their AI-driven content algorithms, weighing in against Google in a pivotal case on digital speech and content moderation.

TITLE: The mass unbanning of suspended Twitter users is underway
SUMMARY: Thousands of previously banned Twitter users, including members of the far-right and users sharing blatant misinformation, have begun to have their accounts restored to the platform, according to an independent analysis.

TITLE: FTC sues to block Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday sued to block Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard, challenging one of the largest tech acquisitions in history.

TITLE: Pentagon awards multibillion-dollar cloud contract to Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Oracle
SUMMARY: The Defense Department has named Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Oracle as the winners of a multibillion-dollar cloud computing contract whose predecessor the Pentagon had to cancel amid Amazon's allegations that then-President Donald Trump had interfered in the award process.

TITLE: Apple abandons controversial plan to check iOS devices and iCloud photos for child abuse imagery
SUMMARY: Apple is abandoning its plans to launch a controversial tool that would check iPhones, iPads and iCloud photos for child sexual abuse material (CSAM) following backlash from critics who decried the feature's potential privacy implications.

TITLE: Former employees suing Twitter speak out on Elon Musk's 'clumsy and inhumane' layoffs
SUMMARY: A group of former Twitter employees who are suing the company spoke out Thursday, alleging that new owner Elon Musk's mass layoffs at the company have triggered multiple labor rights violations.

TITLE: Apple made China the backbone of its iPhone assembly. Shifting away could take years
SUMMARY: In early November, weeks before the peak holiday shopping season was about to kick off, Apple issued an unusual warning: customers would have to wait longer for the new iPhone 14 Pro models. That's because one of its key assembly facilities in the Chinese city of Zhengzhou was "operating at significantly reduced capacity" due to Covid curbs.

TITLE: Elon Musk says Twitter is rolling out a new feature that will flag 'shadowbanning.' It's complicated
SUMMARY: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Thursday said he plans to introduce an option to make it possible for users to determine if the company has limited how many other users can view their posts. In doing so, Musk is effectively seizing on an issue that has been a rallying cry among some conservatives who claim the social network has suppressed or "shadowbanned" their content.

TITLE: As the world courts TSMC, Taiwan worries about losing its 'silicon shield'
SUMMARY: Semiconductor giant TSMC was feted this week by US President Joe Biden and Apple CEO Tim Cook during a ceremony to unveil its $40 billion manufacturing site in Arizona â€” a huge investment designed to help secure America's supply of the most advanced chips.
